newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar mixed, mostly shows pared losses.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar mixed, mostly shows pared losses.

text.p: Most white sugar futures contracts finished slightly easier on Tuesday but well off the lows in modest volume.
A week-long trade gathering in London was contributing to quiet conditions, traders said.
News of damage to the Cuban sugar cane crop which may affect the 1996/97 harvest was greeted calmly by the market.
Cuban authorities said late on Tuesday that the island still aimed to boost its sugar output in the forthcoming season from 4.45 million tonnes in 1995/96.
By the late close most-active December 1996 white sugar futures were 70 cents weaker at $316.70 a tonne after trading in a $315.90 to $317.70 range.
March 1997 futures finished 50 cents weaker at $313.60 after hitting a low of $312.40.
In Paris, nearby December futures ended 40 cents firmer at $316.90. The much less heavily traded March 1997 contract lost $1.30 to $312.80. Total volume was 783 lots.
